page.title: 10 WELLESBOURNE VILLAGE(1)
page.content: Wellesbourne is still classified as a village,although with a population of nearly 5000 it is felt that only a few larger shops are required before it can be known as a town.At the moment the population is increasing quite rapidly with the development of the Dovehouse Estate to the SW of the village. The village is mainly residential with many people working in the nearby towns of Stratford-on-Avon,Warwick and Leamington Spa.However, there are many small shops and a regular bus service to the nearby towns mentioned above.A lot of traffic passes through the village, and a by-pass is being planned,which threatens to separate the Dovehouse Estate from the rest of the village. (continued on page 11)
